details.purpose: To describe body fluids, secretions and substances.

items.items: Details of the findings relating to a bodily fluid, secretion or substance.
The source of the fluid or substance.
A statement about the normality of the fluid or substance.
A description of the fluid or substance.
Statements about the quantity of fluid or secretion.
The volume of the fluid or secretion.
Statement about the change in volume of the fluid or secretion.
The volume of fluid or liquid is stable.
The volume of fluid is decreasing.
The quantity of body fluid is now zero.
The degree of solid material suspended in the fluid.
The fluid or secretion is crystal clear.
There is a small amount of solid suspended in the fluid.
There is a large amount of solid suspended but it still transmits light.
There is so much solid suspended that the fluid does not transmit light.
The fluid is mostly composed of suspended solids.
The fluid flows like an oil.
The fluid is quite thick and flows like cream.
The amount of substance as a category.
There is no longer any fluid /substance.
There is a small amount of fluid/substance.
There is a minimal amount of fluid/substance.
There is a moderate amount of fluid/ substance.
There is a heavy amount of fluid/substance.
There is a large amount of fluid or substance.
Other substances mixed within the main bodily substance being described.
The amount of sediment in the fluid.
There is a very small amount of sediment in the fluid.
There is a moderate amount of sediment in the fluid.
There is a large amount of sediment in the fluid.
The fluid has a consistency like wax.
The smell of the bodily substance.
A text description of the flow rate.
A numerical expression of flow rate.
A text comment about the substance amount.
The quantity expressed as a mass or weight.
Findings specific to substances that are normally fluid.
Findings specific to substances that are normally solid.
Findings realted to the consistency of the substance.
The solid is of a normal consistency.
The solid is soft but with no liquid.
The substance, normally solid, is semi liquid but contains a significant amount of solid material.
The substance, normally solid, has little solid material.
Estimated age of the bodily substance.
The fluid has become partially solidified and dispersed within a containing fluid e.g. particulate meconium within liquor.
